messages.content: What repositories are involved in the modularized version of Disco Diffusion for ComfyUI?
This repo holds a modularized version of [Disco Diffusion](https://github.com/alembics/disco-diffusion) for use with [ComfyUI](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI).
How do I install the Disco Diffusion nodes for ComfyUI?

To install, clone the repository into your `ComfyUI/custom_nodes` folder with `git clone --recursive https://github.com/space-nuko/ComfyUI-Disco-Diffusion`. Activate the virtualenv used with ComfyUI and then run `pip install -r requirements.txt` in the cloned folder.
What does the Guided Diffusion Loader node do?
The Guided Diffusion Loader node loads a Guided Diffusion model checkpoint. All models are automatically downloaded to your `ComfyUI/models/Disco-Diffusion` folder.
What does the OpenAI CLIP Loader node do and what model is recommended for use with ComfyUI's built-in nodes?

The OpenAI CLIP Loader node loads the OpenAI/OpenCLIP format CLIP models. All models are automatically downloaded and cached. The recommended model for use with ComfyUI's built-in nodes is `clip-vit-large-patch14`, found [here](https://huggingface.co/openai/clip-vit-large-patch14/blob/main/pytorch_model.bin).
What is the main function of the Disco Diffusion node?
The main function of the Disco Diffusion node is to act as the main sampler node.
What are the optional settings available in the Disco Diffusion Extra Settings node?
The Disco Diffusion Extra Settings node provides optional settings you can pass into the Disco Diffusion node.
How is the OpenAI CLIP Loader related to ComfyUI's CLIP Loader and CLIP Vision Loader?

If you substitute the OpenAI CLIP Loader with ComfyUI's CLIP Loader and CLIP Vision Loader, you need to copy the CLIP model you use into both the `clip` and `clip_vision` subfolders under your `ComfyUI/models` folder, because ComfyUI can't load both at once from the same model file.
What is the special syntax for writing prompts in the Disco Diffusion node?

The special syntax for writing prompts in the Disco Diffusion node is shown below: `; You can write comments like this. 0:A beautiful painting of a singular lighthouse, shining its light across a tumultuous sea of blood by greg rutkowski and thomas kinkade. Trending on artstation. 0:yellow color scheme 100:This set of prompts start at frame 100. 100:This prompt has weight five:5`.
How does the leading number in a prompt relate to the step number in the generation?
The leading number in front of each prompt indicates which step number in the generation the prompt should begin being used on.
What control does the trailing number have at the end of the prompt?
The trailing number at the end of each prompt is optional and controls the weight of the prompt. You can also have negative weights, but **the sum of all weights cannot equal 0**.
Where can I find more information about the parameters available for Disco Diffusion?

More information about the parameters available for Disco Diffusion can be found in the [Disco Diffusion Cheatsheet](https://botbox.dev/disco-diffusion-cheatsheet/) and the [EZ Charts Gudie](https://ezcharts.miraheze.org/wiki/EZ_Charts).
